intro: Oreocharis rhytidophylla, commonly known as the wrinkled leaf oreocharis, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, wrinkled leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often hidden among the foliage. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to grow in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
